pli-tv-bu-vb-pc92:0.2: The monks’ rules and their analysis
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc92:0.3: The chapter on offenses entailing confession
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc92:1.1: At one time the Buddha was staying at Sāvatthī in the Jeta Grove, Anāthapiṇḍika’s Monastery.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc92:1.2: At that time Venerable Nanda, the Buddha’s cousin, was handsome and graceful. He was 7 centimeters shorter than the Buddha,
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc92:1.3: but he wore a robe that was the same size as the Buddha’s.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc92:1.4: When the senior monks saw him coming,
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc92:1.6: they thought it was the Buddha and got up from their seats.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc92:1.7: But when he came close, they realized who it was, and they complained and criticized him,
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc92:1.8: “How can Venerable Nanda wear a robe the same size as the Buddha’s?” …
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc92:1.9: “Is it true, Nanda, that you do this?”
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc92:1.12: “… Nanda, how can you wear a robe the same size as mine?
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc92:1.13: This won’t give rise to confidence in those without it …
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc92:1.14: And, monks, this training rule should be recited thus:
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc92:1.15: ‘If a monk gets a robe made which is the standard robe measure or larger, it is to be cut down, and he commits an offense entailing confession.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc92:1.16: This is the standard robe measure: nine standard hands-spans long and six wide.’”
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc92:2.1.4: … The monk who has been given the full ordination by a unanimous Sangha through a legal procedure consisting of one motion and three announcements that is irreversible and fit to stand—this sort of monk is meant in this case.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc92:2.1.6: Nine standard hand-spans long and six hand-spans wide.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc92:2.1.8: if he makes one or gets one made, then the effort constitutes wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc92:2.1.9: When he obtains it, it is to be cut down, and he is then to confess an offense entailing confession.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc92:2.1.10: If he finishes what he began himself, he commits an offense entailing confession.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc92:2.1.11: If he gets others to finish what he began himself, he commits an offense entailing confession.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc92:2.1.12: If he finishes himself what was begun by others, he commits an offense entailing confession.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc92:2.1.13: If he gets others to finish what was begun by others, he commits an offense entailing confession.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc92:2.1.14: If he makes one or gets one made for the benefit of someone else, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc92:2.1.15: If he obtains one that was made by someone else and then uses it, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc92:2.2.2: if he makes it smaller than the standard robe;
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc92:2.2.3: if he obtains one made by another that is too large and he cuts it down before using it;
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc92:2.2.4: if he makes a canopy, a floor cover, a cloth screen, a mattress, or a pillow;
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc92:2.2.6: if he is the first offender.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc92:2.2.7: The tenth rule, the training rule on Nanda, is finished.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc92:2.2.8: The ninth sub-chapter on precious things is finished.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc92:2.2.14: “Venerables, the ninety-two rules on confession have been recited.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc92:2.2.15: In regard to this I ask you,
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc92:2.2.21: You are pure in this and therefore silent. I will remember it thus.”
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc92:2.2.22: The section on minor rules has been completed.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc92:2.2.23: The chapter on offenses entailing confession is finished.
